required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Follow up Treatment With Levetiracetam in Subjects of 4 Years and Older With Generalized Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Multicenter, Follow-up Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Levetiracetam (LEV) (Oral Tablets of 166, 250 or 500 mg b.i.d.), at Individualized Doses up to a Maximum of 4000 mg/Day (or 80 mg/kg/Day for Children and Adolescents Less Than 50 kg), in Children (≥ 4 Years Old), Adolescents and Adults Suffering From Primary Generalized Seizures

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label, follow-up study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of levetiracetam (LEV), in children (≥ 4 years old), adolescents and adults suffering from primary generalized seizures.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects having at least 6 months of seizure freedom at any time during the Evaluation Period
Percentage of subjects having at least 6 months of seizure freedom at any time during the Evaluation Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects remaining seizure-free, for the All intent-to-treat (ITT) population, and Tonic-Clonic, Myoclonic, and Absence subpopulations since the beginning of this study N167 (Visit 1) during the Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Visit 1 to the end of the Evaluation Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects remaining seizure-free, for the All intent-to-treat (ITT) population, and Tonic-Clonic, Myoclonic, and Absence subpopulations since the beginning of this study N167 (Visit 1) during the Evaluation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Visit 1 to the end of the Evaluation Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction from N01057 or N166 Baseline to the Evaluation Period in seizure frequency per week for Tonic-Clonic subpopulation seizures types
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From N01057 or N166 Baseline to the Evaluation Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage reduction from N01057 or N166 Baseline to the Evaluation Period in seizure frequency per week for Tonic-Clonic subpopulation seizures types
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From N01057 or N166 Baseline to the Evaluation Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction from N01057 or N166 Baseline to the Evaluation Period in seizure days per week for the ITT population, and Absence and Myoclonic subpopulations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From N01057 or N166 Baseline to the Evaluation Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage reduction from N01057 or N166 Baseline to the Evaluation Period in seizure days per week for the ITT population, and Absence and Myoclonic subpopulations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From N01057 or N166 Baseline to the Evaluation Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Categorical percentage reduction from Baseline to the Evaluation Period in seizure days per week for the ITT population, and Absence and Myoclonic subpopulations
Categorical percentage reduction from Baseline to the Evaluation Period in seizure frequency per week for Tonic-Clonic subpopulation seizures types

arm_group.description: Subjects received treatment up to 1764 days during the Evaluation Period. Up to 4000 mg/day (or 80 mg/kg/day for children and adolescents less than 50 kg). Oral tablets of 166, 250, or 500 mg Levetiracetam twice daily (b.i.d.).

intervention.description: Active Substance: Levetiracetam Pharmaceutical Form: Tablet Concentration: 166 mg Route of Administration: Oral use
Active Substance: Levetiracetam Pharmaceutical Form: Tablet Concentration: 250 mg Route of Administration: Oral use
Active Substance: Levetiracetam Pharmaceutical Form: Tablet Concentration: 500 mg Route of Administration: Oral use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female children, adolescents and adults having completed the final visit of a previous study with levetiracetam (LEV)
- Subjects who were/are suffering from primary generalized (type II) epileptic seizures
- Subjects for whom the Investigator believes a reasonable benefit (efficacy or tolerability) from the long-term administration of LEV may be expected
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known clinically significant acute or chronic illness, for example: cardiac, renal or hepatic dysfunction, etc., which may impair reliable participation in the trial or necessitate the use of medication not allowed by protocol
- Concomitant use of any drug with possible central nervous system effects unless at a stable dose
- Concomitant use of any drug (other than hormonal treatment and the subject's normal anti-epileptic drugs (AEDs) that may influence the metabolism of the concomitant AED(s), except if the dose has been stable before entry in the study for sufficient length of time
